intro: Psychotria griffithii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in lowland rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
